page.title: 19Mr.Broom
page.content: Mr.Broom owns a pasture farm in Thorpe Langton.The big old farmhouse was built in the 17th century.Mr.Broom has one full-time worker and one who works 3 times a week.He stores some grass for winter.He has has 3 tractors,a manure spreader,a hay turner and a weed sprayer.He gets up at 5.45.In June he has 400 cattle(200 in winter),400 ewes,150 sows and 900 piglets.He farms his own 200 acres and 150 acres that are rented. Some animals go to market and some to the slaughterhouse.The animals kept outside eat grass in summer. The piglets eat 6 pounds of food each day. Foxes have taken 2 lambs this year. Rabbits are another pest.Mr.Broom uses 3 dogs and 1 horse for shepherding.He finishes work when it gets dark.
